channel.title: FREE Internet For LIFE!
channel.description:
Well All You Need Is A Modem Which Means This Is Dial-Up A Decent #'s Though Ok Go To www.metconnect.net And Get Some ##S MAKE SURE ITS NOT LONG DISTANCE Now Goto Control Panal>Net Work And Internet Connections>Network Connections Then On the Side There Is "Create A Network connection" Click It Follow These Steps: Click Next Next Again Then Click Set Up My Connecting Manually. [2ND ONE] Click Next Type Any Name Put The #### In There One I Use is [code]12123592000[/code] Put ANy Usernam/Pass And Click Finish! Well You DONE!!!
A Decent Program That Can Disconnect You From The Internet When Someone Calls Is "PhoneTry"
Download It From Download.com and just mess wit it

item.title: FREE Internet For LIFE!
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

I don’t know if an Electric company does it 100%, but I know that Cable companies do it. How it works is they have like, ‘beacons’ - for lack of better term, set for people who use their services. It monitors the respectful Cable box that you have in your house. If they find that a house is receiving this service without a box, or an unmarked box, they find out. I don’t really know how it works, but thats what I’ve come to know when my dad use to steal cable.

Read full topic

item.title: FREE Internet For LIFE!
item.dc:creator: @kmb Kmb
item.description:
@kmb wrote:

exe626:

Bang Train, every person who buys electric is marked on like a map, when somebody not on their little map is getting power, a little alarm goes off and they find them eventually. Even if their getting power from another house, they are still detectable.

No matter how many times I tried reading this, I just cannot explain to myself how this is possible. If I steal electricity from my neighbor, he might see it as increase in his electricity bill, or he just might notice the weird looking wire from his plug box to my house. But hell, how can the company he bought the electricity from detect this? Unless I have missed something critical…

Read full topic

item.title: FREE Internet For LIFE!
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:18, topic:127693”]Using wifi to get free internet is a bad idea. My cousin’s friend who does a lot of illegal downloading was using WIFI to connect to the internet and was stealing someone else’s internet to get it for free. The guy he was stealing it from saw some strange connections going through his modem (beats me how he knew, maybe he used netstat or maybe when he wasn’t doing anything he thought something was wrong when the modem lights flickered on and off without him using it lol).

He then used a packet sniffer and some other program to find out the guy’s location. The packet sniffer was used to black mail him and the other program to find out the guy’s location was used so he could catch him and he did lol.

Was one funny story because that dude was pissed off. He got a little smarter and lowered his wireless Internet modem’s frequency so it didn’t leave his room.[/quote]
how can he find out the exact location of the person?

Read full topic

item.title: FREE Internet For LIFE!
item.dc:creator: @Ferty Ferty
item.description:
@Ferty wrote:

[quote=“therealjdb, post:15, topic:127693”][quote author=exe626 link=topic=178322.msg1643872#msg1643872 date=1185983901]
All of the sudden the power goes out!
knock knock
You: “Yes?”
Police officer: “YOUR UNDER ARREST FOR STEALING ELECTRIC!”
You: “HOLY SHIT”
Fin
Thats what happens when you steal electric, they always find out when you do.
[/quote]
Lol, if you say so. Anyways it IS possible.[/quote]

Well i suppose if you constructed a plasma gun on un godly proportions and aimed it at your neighbors house you may be able to draw electrical power wirelessly from there ground line, although I assume the effect on near by carbon based life forms would be catastrophic at the least

Read full topic

item.title: FREE Internet For LIFE!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Using wifi to get free internet is a bad idea. My cousin’s friend who does a lot of illegal downloading was using WIFI to connect to the internet and was stealing someone else’s internet to get it for free. The guy he was stealing it from saw some strange connections going through his modem (beats me how he knew, maybe he used netstat or maybe when he wasn’t doing anything he thought something was wrong when the modem lights flickered on and off without him using it lol).

He then used a packet sniffer and some other program to find out the guy’s location. The packet sniffer was used to black mail him and the other program to find out the guy’s location was used so he could catch him and he did lol.

Was one funny story because that dude was pissed off. He got a little smarter and lowered his wireless Internet modem’s frequency so it didn’t leave his room.

Read full topic

item.title: FREE Internet For LIFE!
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Its like getting Cable for free, it has to come from somewhere, right? If you have cable coming into your house illegally, it shows this to the ‘who ever’(can’t think right now… so I don’t know the name) and they come knocking on your door, telling you to disconnect it, ect(My dad use to steal cable ;)). The same applies for your electric, if their electric is going somewhere that isn’t paying, they know it.

Read full topic

@mrrules wrote:

Lol the cops arnt going to come busting down your door just for using someones internet. Cause alot of people that live in arparments buildings do this so they don’t have to buy internet. What we did… We found the guy across the street high jacking ours and we made it so we could only connect and in the next 2 days the cox people were at his house setting his internet up. LOL
